archimate:DataObject.name: ASIC
archimate:DataObject.documentation: An ASIC is an Application Specific Integrated Circuit. This class represents a special type of Chip that is used to upgrade the functionality of a networking device. Examples include upgrading the modem function of a device; increasing the processing capability of a Card or Device; and implementing some type of networking functionality; such as fast switching; directly in hardware (as opposed to emulating it in software).
